DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Calf Right Edema Assessment Circumference Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related limb (a body region referring to an upper or lower extremity) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues)._The posterior aspect of the lower extremity that extends from the knee to the foot. (NCI)_Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._The length of the closed curve of a circle; the size of something as given by the distance around it._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Calf Right Edema Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related limb (a body region referring to an upper or lower extremity) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues)._The posterior aspect of the lower extremity that extends from the knee to the foot. (NCI)_Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Relationship Limb Calf Right Edema
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.:The posterior aspect of the lower extremity that extends from the knee to the foot.:Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.:Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.
The posterior aspect of the lower extremity that extends from the knee to the foot.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.
